Military researchers say they've always known that soldiers who go through combatives training, occasionally get hurt.
But until recently, a lot of military officials didn't take concussions seriously.
Then came Iraq and Afghanistan.
Press reports, and studies, suggested the thousands of soldiers who suffered concussions had trouble thinking and using judgment and remembering.
And Army researchers wanted to develop a reliable test that can diagnose these injuries.
So last summer, they went to Fort Hood and a few other bases, to try to find soldiers who had concussions so they could try out different tests.
And the researchers were struck how fast they found test subjects - in combatives class.
